{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Brookstone |model=Rover Revolution (851135) |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=11/13/2013 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=small remote-controlled vehicle |fcc_id=ZRB851135 |ic_id=10612A-851135 |us_id= |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand= |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT3070 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none=true |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed= |lan_ports= |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags=battery powered |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=Rover3_0022C0XXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^Rover3_0022C0[A-F0-9]{6}$ |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:22:C0 |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|Wireless Spy Vehicle with App Control}}
This is a small RC vehicle controllable (with a camera + mic) remotely controllable via an '''Android''' or '''iOS''' app. :The vehicle itself would seem to act as an AP - a direct connection to the device seems to be needed to control it.
"BS00006A", "2013-7-6", and "VER 2.0" is silkscreened on the bottom of the main board. :"BL-RT3070-M2" <??> and "2013.5.27" would appear to be silkscreened on the wireless module.. indicating '''B-LINK''' manufacture.
The manufacturer stated within the FCC docs is '''Guangzhou Panyu Fantasia Creation Toys Co., Ltd.'''.. which would appear to be associated with [http://www.acctron.net.cn/ '''Acctron'''] and [http://www.nano-vation.net/index.html '''Nanovation'''].
A label affixed to the device in the FCC external photos indicates the default SSID format is '''Rover3_XXXXXXXXXXXX''' ('''Rover3_''' + the presumed MAC). :The MAC shown has a 00:22:C0 ('''Shenzhen Forcelink Electronic''') OUI. It is presumed to be used...
